author: Willy
content: Sounds like #2 was poor management and wrecked a good thing. #3 came along and believed the lie that #2 was feeding about a buyer being on the hook. Then the truth came out and now #3 is selling off the remnants with out trying to see if old management could ressurect the mess up of #2.

author: Doug Bostrom
content:
Short product life-cycles, too many variants, limited production, inability to resist the latest and greatest advances in material science add up to produce insufficient profit. Once another investment vehicle shows promise of more consistent and better returns often found in conjunction with better discipline, that’s where money will go regardless of whether the new opportunity involves drowning nuns and orphans or doing something that coincidentally resembles Good Work.

Working with abstracted money is a bit of deal with the devil. Signer beware.
